intro: Gouldia hillebrandii f. eutypica, commonly known as the pink gouldia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its striking pink or red floral spikes. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and thrives in well-drained sandy soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique appearance. Gouldia hillebrandii f. eutypica is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter.
